intro: Sisymbrium guatemalense, commonly known as Guatemalan mustards, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium guatemalense is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
